## Section 2. Hospital & Surgical Expenses
In the event Your Maid is hospitalized due to an Injury or Illness sustained during the Period of Insurance and Hospital and Surgical Expenses are incurred for day surgery or for inpatient confinement in a class B2 or C ward in a Singapore Government Restructured Hospital, We will pay for such expenses up to the Annual Sub-Limit as specified in the Policy Schedule, subjected to 25% co-payment in excess of $15,000 as applicable.
questions: How does the policy define the eligibility for hospital and surgical expense coverage for Your Maid in terms of injury or illness timing, ward class, and hospital type, and how do the annual sub-limit and co-payment conditions apply?
In what scenarios would day surgery expenses for Your Maid be covered under this section, and how do the co-payment and excess thresholds affect the reimbursement amount?
How does the requirement for confinement in a class B2 or C ward within a Singapore Government Restructured Hospital influence the coverage of hospital and surgical expenses for Your Maid?

What documentation or proof might be necessary to demonstrate that hospital and surgical expenses were incurred during the Period of Insurance and within the specified ward and hospital type for Your Maid?
How does the 25% co-payment in excess of $15,000 operate in practice when hospital and surgical expenses exceed this amount for Your Maid's treatment?
If Your Maid is hospitalized for an illness sustained before the Period of Insurance, how would that affect the coverage of hospital and surgical expenses under this section?
Are hospital and surgical expenses incurred in private hospitals or wards other than class B2 or C wards in Singapore Government Restructured Hospitals covered under this section for Your Maid?
How does the policy handle hospital and surgical expenses for Your Maid if the treatment involves both day surgery and inpatient confinement during the Period of Insurance?
What is the impact of the Annual Sub-Limit specified in the Policy Schedule on the maximum payable amount for hospital and surgical expenses for Your Maid?
How would the co-payment clause affect a claim where hospital and surgical expenses total exactly $15,000 for Your Maid?
In cases where Your Maid is hospitalized multiple times during the Period of Insurance, how does the Annual Sub-Limit and co-payment apply across these separate hospitalizations?
How does the policy address hospital and surgical expenses if Your Maid is hospitalized outside Singapore or in a non-Government Restructured Hospital?
What are the implications if hospital and surgical expenses are incurred for Your Maid in a ward class higher than B2 or C within a Singapore Government Restructured Hospital?
How does the policy define 'Injury or Illness sustained during the Period of Insurance' in relation to hospital and surgical expense claims for Your Maid?
If hospital and surgical expenses are partially covered by another insurance, how does this section's co-payment and annual sub-limit apply to the remaining amount for Your Maid?
What exclusions or general policy conditions might override or limit the hospital and surgical expense coverage for Your Maid under this section?
How does the policy treat hospital and surgical expenses incurred for Your Maid if the injury or illness is related to pre-existing conditions or excluded causes?
What is the process and timing for submitting claims for hospital and surgical expenses incurred by Your Maid to ensure coverage under this section?
How does the co-payment requirement interact with the Annual Sub-Limit when hospital and surgical expenses are significantly high for Your Maid?
In the event of a dispute regarding the classification of the ward or hospital where Your Maid was treated, how would the coverage of hospital and surgical expenses be determined under this section?
